Reason: The 'partitioner' configuration is performance-sensitive because it directly affects how data is distributed across nodes in the cluster, which can lead to notable performance variations at the system level. Changing the partitioner configuration can have a significant impact on system performance as it involves time-extensive operations related to data distribution. Additionally, the developer's information indicates that changing the partitioner configuration requires reloading all data and can lead to data inconsistency if not done carefully, further emphasizing its performance sensitivity.
